docs.abstract: Correction: Oct 29 article about growing tendency to blame obesity for range of societal problems misattributed journal that published letter about how much extra fuel airlines use carrying fatter Americans; article also misspelled name of political science professor quoted
docs.lead_paragraph: An article last Sunday about a tendency to blame obesity for a range of problems misattributed the journal that published a letter about how much extra fuel airlines use carrying fatter Americans. It was the American Journal of Preventive Medicine, not The American Journal of Public Health. The article also misspelled the name of a Brown University political science professor who commented that the intent of such studies is to persuade the obese to lose weight. He is James Morone, not Marone.

headline.print_headline: Yes, Red Wine Holds Answer. Check Dosage.
headline.main: Yes, Red Wine Holds Answer. Check Dosage.

docs.lead_paragraph: A new report found that a natural substance found in red wine offsets the bad effects of a high-calorie diet in mice.
docs.snippet: A new report found that a natural substance found in red wine offsets the bad effects of a high-calorie diet in mice.

headline.main: Substance in Red Wine Extends Life of Mice

docs.lead_paragraph: A new report found that resveratrol offsets the bad effects of a high-calorie diet in mice and extends their lifespan.
docs.snippet: A new report found that resveratrol offsets the bad effects of a high-calorie diet in mice and extends their lifespan.
